titlStmt.titl: Land Tenure Shapes Black Bear Density and Abundance on a Multi-Use Landscape

citation.biblCit: Anne Loosen, 2020, "Land Tenure Shapes Black Bear Density and Abundance on a Multi-Use Landscape", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/YT7ZZW, UAL Dataverse, V1, UNF:6:1XlczB63fc6ZcmVi3JwSug== [fileUNF]

titlStmt.titl: Land Tenure Shapes Black Bear Density and Abundance on a Multi-Use Landscape

stdyInfo.abstract:
Data for resource selection function (RSF) and spatially explicit capture recapture (SECR) analyses completed for the manuscript titled "Land Tenure Shapes Black Bear Density and Abundance on a Multi-Use Landscape" published in Ecology and Evolution. For any and all data usages, please cite:
Loosen AE, Morehouse AT, Boyce MS. Land tenure shapes black bear density and abundance on a multi‐use landscape. Ecol Evol. 2018;00:1–17. https://doi.org/10.1002/ece3.4617

useStmt.restrctn: There is a 1-year embargo on using this data (from date of publication + 1 year).

citation.biblCit: Loosen AE, Morehouse AT, Boyce MS. Land tenure shapes black bear density and abundance on a multi‐use landscape. Ecol Evol. 2018;00:1–17. https://doi.org/10.1002/ece3.4617
